subproject.title: Water Governance CoP support

subproject.description:
The aim of the programme is to define new areas of opportunities in the RBEC region for the development of new projects in the cross-cutting field of human rights and water governance with ultimate goal to bridge the gap between theory and practice with regard to the right to water.
The overall approach of the programme is to strengthen region capacity in this area, and in particular, capacities of BRC to support COs in development of the concrete interventions, programmes and projects. This will be sequenced as three consecutive steps: 
• Step 1 – individual country assessments (desk studies), TORs and work plans for next steps 
• Step 2 – detailed in-country assessments with focus on the design of future projects and interventions, including stakeholder consultations, the development of detailed project proposals ready for submission/approval, as well as partner and resource mobilization. 
• Step 3 - launching of concrete projects (endorsement, recruitment or procurement), inception, implementation, reporting and monitoring as well as ex-post project evaluation when applicable. 
The BRC will play an overall facilitation role with a focus on initial assessments and support of activities at national level, and in particular advocacy, knowledge management, building of partnerships and resource mobilisation, while in-depth country assessments, project development and implementation (Phase 2 and 3) in the selected target countries will be the responsibility mainly of country offices.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: HRBA to Water Governance

title: Water Governance - strengthening reg capacity in RBEC
